Introduction

Font Size Scale (Pro) is an advanced Figma plugin for scaling text sizes with precision and ease. It enables designers to update text sizes quickly, streamlining your design workflow.


Function Description

This plugin provides two scaling modes: continuous scaling and step-wise scaling. The continuous mode adjusts font sizes by a ratio, while the step-wise mode increases or decreases font sizes by fixed increments. In addition, any frames or groups that contain text are renamed with a suffix that indicates the applied scale change.


Usage

1.Select the text layers, frames, or groups you wish to scale.

2.Choose the desired scaling mode by clicking on the corresponding tab.

3.For continuous scaling, adjust the scale ratio via the slider; for step-wise scaling, use the custom number input to specify the step value.

4.Click the â€œApply Scaleâ€ button to perform the scaling operation.

5.Make sure that all necessary fonts are loaded.


Notes

â€¢Ensure that your selection includes text nodes.

â€¢Both standalone text layers and containers that hold text are supported.

â€¢When scaling large designs, review your layout as some adjustments might affect the overall design consistency.

plugins.description:
ğŸŒˆ Tinctify â€“ Gradient & Palette Editor for Design Systems


â€œTinct: To tinge or tint, as with color; hence, figuratively, to imbue.â€ â€“ The Century Dictionary


Tinctify is a powerful, design-systemâ€“ready, color palette editor that lets you craft beautiful, consistent gradients from any base color right inside Figma.


Create structured color palettes with unlimited base colors, each generating smooth, adjustable gradients with 10 stops, labeled from 50 to 900 following the Material Design naming convention (from lightest to darkest).


Tinctify gives you full visual and numeric control over hue, saturation, lightness, and naming â€” all in an intuitive and powerful interface.


âœ¨ Core Features:


ğŸ¨ Palette-Based Gradient Editor

Define base colors and generate 10-step gradients (50â€“900) per Material Design naming.


ğŸ§  Smart Curve Editor

Precisely control hue, saturation, and lightness with intuitive curve handles and per-channel strength sliders.


ğŸ§ª Color Accessibility Simulation

Preview your palette under luminance and various forms of color blindness (protanopia, deuteranopia, tritanopia, etc.).


ğŸ” Visual Color Picker & Wheel

Fine-tune using RGB, HSL sliders, a color wheel, or triangle. See how colors are placed in relation to each other on the color wheel.


ğŸ“¥ Import/Export with Color Charts

Save your palettes as smart color charts and re-import them across projects â€” portable and future-proof.


ğŸ”— Figma Variable Integration

Export your palette to a Figma variable collection in one click.



ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ¨ Ideal for:


Design systems and token-based color workflows


UI/UX designers needing structured shade scales


Teams who want accessible, flexible color palettes


Designers tired of wrestling with manual gradient building



ğŸ’µ One-Time Purchase


Buy once â€” use forever.


No subscriptions. No lock-in. Just powerful color tooling that belongs to you.

Introduction

The "Base64 Generator" plugin enables you to convert selected Figma elements into Base64-encoded images. You can preview the generated image, adjust its resolution, and easily copy the Base64 code to your clipboard.


Function Description

  1. Generate Base64: Convert any selected Figma element into a Base64-encoded image.
  2. Preview Image: View the Base64 image directly in the plugin interface.
  3. Image Resolution: Adjust the image's resolution using a multiplier (e.g., 1x, 2x).
  4. Copy to Clipboard: Copy the generated Base64 code with a single click.


How to Use

  1. Select a Figma element (image, vector, or other graphic elements).
  2. Open the "Base64 Generator" plugin.
  3. Choose a resolution multiplier (1x, 2x, etc.).
  4. Click "Generate Base64" to generate the Base64 code.
  5. View the generated image and copy the Base64 code to the clipboard.


Precautions

  1. Only visible layers can be converted into Base64. Hidden layers will be ignored.
  2. The plugin is designed for images and vector elements.
  3. Ensure the image size is appropriate for better performance when generating Base64.

  3. Choose a resolution multiplier (1x, 2x, etc.).
  4. Click "Generate Base64" to generate the Base64 code.
  5. View the generated image and copy the Base64 code to the clipboard.


Precautions

  1. Only visible layers can be converted into Base64. Hidden layers will be ignored.
  2. The plugin is designed for images and vector elements.
  3. Ensure the image size is appropriate for better performance when generating Base64.

Introduction

Slice Export Assistant Pro is a powerful tool designed for Figma users to streamline the process of slicing and exporting assets. This plugin allows you to easily manage and export multiple slices with customizable naming rules, formats, and scales.


Function Description

  1. Advanced Slice Management: Automatically slice and export assets based on user-defined rules.
  2. Customizable Export Options: Choose formats like PNG, JPG, SVG, PDF, or WEBP, with customizable scales and prefixes.
  3. Batch Operations: Export multiple slices in one go with the ability to define custom naming rules.
  4. Translation Support: One-click translation of slice names to English, with support for other languages.
  5. User-Friendly Interface: Intuitive and easy-to-navigate interface to manage export settings and slices.
  6. Export Preview: Preview slices before exporting to ensure accuracy.
  7. History & Quick Access: Save and quickly reuse previous naming rules with an easy-to-use history feature.
  8. Overlay and Loading Animation: Provides real-time feedback with loading overlays and animations for a smoother user experience.


How to Use

  1. Set Up Slicing Rules: Input your custom naming rules in the input field.
  2. Select Slices: Click on the â€œGet Slicesâ€ button to automatically detect slices in your project.
  3. Customize Exports: Choose your desired export format, scale, and prefix.
  4. Batch Export: Click â€œDownloadâ€ to batch export your slices in your selected format.
  5. Translation: Use the "Translate" button to instantly translate slice names from Chinese to English.
  6. Full Selection: Use the "Select All" button for easy selection of all slices.


Important Notes

  1. Ensure you select slices before exporting.
  2. Only supported formats (PNG, JPG, SVG, PDF, WEBP) can be used for export.
  3. The translation feature supports only Chinese-to-English translations for now.

plugins.name: Layer Name To Text
plugins.description:
Instantly Add Layer Name Tags Beside Your Components

Tired of manually labeling component layers for documentation, presentations, or handoff?

Layer Name Labels is a simple yet powerful plugin that automates this process for you.


âœ… What It Does

Layer Name Labels scans your selected component or frame and reads the names of visible layers. It then adds a text label next to each layer, mirroring its layer nameâ€”perfect for documentation, audits, teaching materials, or internal reviews.


ğŸ’¡ Why You'll Love It

âš¡ One-click operation â€“ Just select your components or frames and run the plugin.


ğŸ§  Smart placement â€“ Labels appear right next to each target layer.


âœ¨ Non-destructive â€“ Original design stays untouched. Labels are added as separate text layers.


ğŸ§© Works with nested components â€“ Recursively finds and labels layers inside complex structures.


ğŸ› ï¸ Perfect for:

Developer handoffs

Design system documentation

Training materials

Accessibility audits


ğŸ› ï¸ How It Works

Select any frame, group, or group of components.

Run the plugin.

Instantly see text layers added beside each target with its layer name.

Notes

118146.release_notes:
âœ¨ What's New?
âœ… Auto Layout Support â€“ Initials now stay centered automatically.
âœ… Fixed Frame Dimensions â€“ Prevents unwanted width/height changes.
âœ… Better Component Support â€“ Works inside instances without breaking overrides.
âœ… Improved Stroke Handling â€“ Optional white stroke stays inside the frame.
âœ… Smarter Initials Replacement â€“ Removes old initials before generating new ones.

ğŸ”§ How It Works
- Select a frame (with or without Auto Layout).
- Click "Generate" â†’ Adds random initials, background, and (optional) stroke.

plugins.name: æ‰¹é‡ç»„ä»¶å¡«å…… Batch Component Fill
plugins.description:
Introduction

Batch Component Fill is a highly efficient and user-friendly Figma plugin designed for designers and teams who need to quickly batch-fill component content. It supports data pasting from Excel, auto-layout frames, and highly customizable workflows.


Function Description

  1. Batch Component Fill: Fill text boxes of multiple components at once.
  2. Excel Data Paste: Copy data directly from Excel and paste it into the plugin. The plugin will parse the table and generate corresponding content automatically.
  3. Auto-Layout Support: Generated content is wrapped in an auto-layout frame with adjustable spacing.
  4. Progress Feedback: Provides real-time progress feedback during the filling process.
  5. Text Layer Conflict Detection: If there are conflicting text layer names in the component, the plugin will flag and notify the user.


Usage

  1. Open the plugin "Batch Component Fill" in Figma.
  2. Select a component or instance with text layers.
  3. Paste table data (supports copying from Excel directly into the plugin).
  4. Click "Generate Content" to automatically generate component instances wrapped in an auto-layout frame based on the data.
  5. After generation, you can manually adjust the results if needed.


Notes

  1. Component Selection Requirement: Ensure a component or instance with text layers is selected.
  2. Unique Text Layer Names: Ensure all text layer names in the component are unique to avoid data conflicts.
  3. Excel Data Format: Make sure table data is properly formatted, with each cell corresponding to a text layer in the component.
  4. Auto-Layout Limitations: Generated content is automatically arranged in a vertically oriented auto-layout frame with a default spacing of 50px, which can be adjusted manually.

plugins.description:
Introduction

Layer Cleaner is a powerful Figma plugin designed to help you efficiently manage your layers. With easy-to-use functions, it allows you to fold layers, clear hidden layers, or do both at once. Clean and organize your workspace for smoother design workflows.


Function Description

  1. Fold Layers: Collapses all layers in the selected elements, including groups, frames, and components.
  2. Clear Hidden Layers: Removes all hidden layers under the selected elements, improving file performance.
  3. Fold and Clear Hidden Layers: Combines both actionsâ€”folding all layers and clearing hidden layersâ€”into one simple click.


How to Use

  1. Select the elements you want to work with.
  2. Choose one of the options in the plugin:
  3. Fold Layers to collapse all layers.
  4. Clear Hidden Layers to delete all hidden layers.
  5. Fold and Clear to perform both actions at once.
  6. The plugin will notify you once the action is complete.


Notes

  1. The plugin only affects the selected layers and elements.
  2. Make sure to save your work before using the plugin, as the changes are irreversible.

plugins.name: PDFå¯¼å‡ºå·¥å…· PDF Export Tool
plugins.description:
Introduction

The PDF Export Tool is a powerful Figma plugin designed to help designers effortlessly export selected design elements into high-quality PDF files. Whether exporting a single element or multiple elements, the PDF Export Tool streamlines the conversion process, enhancing your productivity.


Function Description

  1. Multiple Element Export: Export multiple selected design elements at once, with each element automatically generating a separate page in the PDF.
  2. High-Quality Images: Ensures that the exported PDF maintains the original resolution and clarity of your design elements.
  3. Easy Operation: Complete the export process with just a few clicks, eliminating the need for complex settings.
  4. Automatic Naming: The generated PDF file is automatically named â€œexported_elements.pdfâ€ for easy retrieval and management.


Usage Instructions

  1. Select Elements: In Figma, select one or more design elements you wish to export.
  2. Run the Plugin: Navigate to Plugins > Development > PDFå¯¼å‡ºå·¥å…· PDF Export Tool in the menu bar.
  3. Export PDF: In the plugin window that appears, click the â€œExport as PDFâ€ button.
  4. Download File: The plugin will automatically generate and download a PDF file containing your selected elements.


Precautions

  1. Compatibility: Ensure that the selected elements support export in PNG format; otherwise, the export may fail.
  2. File Size: Exporting a large number of high-resolution elements may result in a larger PDF file and may take more time to generate.

plugins.tagline: Quickly Export Your Designs to PDF

137599.name: PDFå¯¼å‡ºå·¥å…· PDF Export Tool
137599.description:
Introduction

The PDF Export Tool is a powerful Figma plugin designed to help designers effortlessly export selected design elements into high-quality PDF files. Whether exporting a single element or multiple elements, the PDF Export Tool streamlines the conversion process, enhancing your productivity.


Function Description

  1. Multiple Element Export: Export multiple selected design elements at once, with each element automatically generating a separate page in the PDF.
  2. High-Quality Images: Ensures that the exported PDF maintains the original resolution and clarity of your design elements.
  3. Easy Operation: Complete the export process with just a few clicks, eliminating the need for complex settings.
  4. Automatic Naming: The generated PDF file is automatically named â€œexported_elements.pdfâ€ for easy retrieval and management.


Usage Instructions

  1. Select Elements: In Figma, select one or more design elements you wish to export.
  2. Run the Plugin: Navigate to Plugins > Development > PDFå¯¼å‡ºå·¥å…· PDF Export Tool in the menu bar.
  3. Export PDF: In the plugin window that appears, click the â€œExport as PDFâ€ button.
  4. Download File: The plugin will automatically generate and download a PDF file containing your selected elements.


Precautions

  1. Compatibility: Ensure that the selected elements support export in PNG format; otherwise, the export may fail.
  2. File Size: Exporting a large number of high-resolution elements may result in a larger PDF file and may take more time to generate.

plugins.name: è‰²å€¼è½¬æ¢å™¨ Color Format Converter
plugins.description:
Introduction

"Color Format Converter" is a lightweight Figma plugin that simplifies viewing, converting, and copying all colors (including child elements) within your selected objects. It supports multiple color formatsâ€”Hex, RGB, HSL, HSB, UIColorâ€”and enhances your workflow efficiency.


Function Description

  1. Extract all color information (solid fills, gradients, strokes, and text colors) from the selected layers and their children.
  2. Display colors in various formats: Hex (with alpha), RGB(A), HSL(A), HSB(A), UIColor.
  3. Parallel display of a stable column (Hex+Opacity) and a convertible format column. The stable column remains fixed, while the convertible format can be switched from a dropdown.
  4. Click the convertible format value to copy it, with a success notification appearing in Figma.


Usage

  1. Install and run the plugin in Figma.
  2. Select any object (including groups or components). The plugin automatically extracts all related colors.
  3. Use the dropdown in the plugin panel to change the displayed convertible color format.
  4. Click on a convertible format value to copy it and receive a success notification.


Notes

  1. Ensure a secure context (HTTPS) for direct clipboard API usage. A fallback method is employed otherwise.
  2. If no color is present in the selection, the plugin will display an empty list.

plugins.name: Resonote - Share and Collaborate
plugins.description:
Overview

Ever found a stakeholder wandering your file looking for a design? Or having to share the same link number of times to get some feedback. With this plugin you can create a dedicated collaborative space with a sharable link for a specific design within your file. Within this space you can easily collect feedback and log actions. Here's an example of the collaborative space.


How to use

  1. First locate the design frame you want create a dedicated space for, it can be a single design or multiple designs within a frame.
  2. Then within the plugin add a name for the design project and the iteration you're adding with a quick description - it could be a feedback request or annotations for the design.
  3. Finally choose the format you want to upload the frame to the dedicated space, it can either be an image or embedded Figma frame.
  4. After you upload the frame to the dedicated space the link will be generated below, if you want to add to the same project after, use the same link and choose 'add to project'.


Example use cases

  1. Tracking design iterations and collecting feedback from the team and stakeholder, with each new iteration including how the feedback was actioned and how the design evolved.
  2. Showcasing different states of design evolution (crawl, walk, run) for stakeholders in a easily sharable link tracking related feedback.
  3. Using iterations for different parts of the designs and tracking related feedback in one space to see how the overall design evolves.


Note

  1. When uploading as an image will make the selected frame or section content public, use at own risk or switch to embed to retain existing file access settings.
  2. Plugin and collaborative feedback space is currently in alpha stage, things will evolve and any feedback or suggestion are more then welcome!
plugins.tagline: Create and share a feedback space to collaborate with your team and stakeholders

plugins.name: BartTextToDesignNow
plugins.description:
Iâ€™m excited to share a new Figma plugin Iâ€™ve been working on. Itâ€™s still in the early stages, but the idea is simple and powerful: you can describe what you want to see, and the plugin will draw it for you. Iâ€™m really thankful for any support or feedback you can offer as I continue to develop it.


At the moment, the plugin is focused on basic shapes. For example, you could type, "Draw a rectangle, 450 width, 600 height, 45 stroke size, red stroke color, yellow fill color," and the plugin will generate that exact shape on your canvas. The key is to keep your instructions straightforward and precise.


To help you along the way, the plugin provides helpful hints at the bottom of the screen as you type your commands. This should make it easier to craft the right instruction and get the results youâ€™re looking for.


If you make a mistake or want to adjust something, you can use the "Previous" command to go back to the last command you entered. This allows you to easily refine your design without starting from scratch.


This plugin is just getting started, so your feedback and support are crucial as I continue to improve and add more features. Thank you for trying it out!

plugins.name: QuikA11y
plugins.description:
Make accessibility seamless. Reference with confidence.


Good design requires understanding accessibility, and you want your design decisions to feel informed. While many accessibility tools exist, they don't focus on educating teams about key standards and guidelines. That's the gap QuikA11y fills â€” making accessibility education effortless, quick, and easy to find.


QuikA11y is a plugin that focuses on educating accessibility standards. Discover instant access to WCAG 2.2 guidelines and empower your design process with expert knowledge and educational insights.


Features:

  1. Quick search on WCAG 2.2 guidelines
  2. Reference all WCAG 2.2 standards and success criteria
  3. Key links to essential WCAG documents and resources
  4. Share accessibility rationales with your team
  5. Place reference notes directly in your designs
  6. Educate and build accessibility awareness
  7. Light and Dark theme to match your preference
  8. Native Figma look and feel

accepted.name: Alex Vong
accepted.description: Hi, I'm Alex;âœŒï¸ I'm a designer and front-end developer passionate about crafting beautiful and delightful user interactions through modern web technology.

plugins.name: Superduper Maps
plugins.description:
Superduper Maps brings real, interactive maps directly into your Figma designs. No more static screenshots or placeholder rectanglesâ€”insert dynamic, customizable maps with a single click. Pan, zoom, and explore in real-time, then export crisp, production-ready maps at any resolution. With 3D camera controls, custom styling options, and frame-perfect sizing, you can create stunning location-based designs that match your exact vision.


Core Features


ğŸ—ºï¸ Interactive Map Preview

  1. Live canvas with real-time pan and zoom
  2. Smooth, responsive map exploration before inserting
  3. Instant visual feedback for all adjustments


ğŸ“ Precision Location Control

  1. Search any location worldwide with integrated geocoding
  2. Fine-tune latitude, longitude, and zoom levels
  3. One-click reset to default view


ğŸ¨ Professional Map Styles

  1. Access to 8+ premium map themes (Streets, Outdoors, Light, Dark, Satellite, Navigation)
  2. Import and save custom styles for brand consistency
  3. Real-time style switching and preview


ğŸ“ Advanced Camera Controls

  1. 3D perspective with adjustable bearing (0-360Â°) and tilt (0-60Â°)
  2. Create dramatic map angles and cinematic views
  3. Perfect for hero sections and showcase designs


âš¡ Smart Frame Integration

  1. Automatically detects selected Figma frames
  2. Maps adapt perfectly to your frame dimensions
  3. Frame-perfect sizing every time


ğŸ–¼ï¸ High-Quality Export

  1. Export at 1x for web or 2x for retina displays
  2. Up to 4000x4000px export capability
  3. Consistent geographic coverage that matches preview


ğŸš€ Performance Optimised

  1. Intelligent tile caching for faster loading
  2. Offline support for previously viewed areas
  3. Built specifically for Figma's architecture


Superduper Maps Pro

  1. 50 daily exports (vs 5 lifetime on free tier)
  2. Unlimited usage with your own Mapbox API key
  3. Cancel anytime - no long-term commitments


Coming Soon

  1. Google Maps integration
  2. OpenStreetMap support

plugins.name: Data Grid Master
plugins.description:
Apply full spreadsheets to any data grid of your choice in Figma within seconds.

Data Grid Master supports CSV uploads or copy-paste from Excel, Google Sheets, or any spreadsheet tool.

Just pick a single cell in your grid, let the plugin find all other cells that match it and select the property to modify if it is a component. Text nodes are set directly.

Choose whether to upload a CSV file or paste your spreadsheet data, hit apply â€” done.


Tested with AG Grid, MUI-X Data Grid, and many others â€” works with any professional data grid setup.

The only requirement: cells must share the same name in Figma.


Full tutorial is available here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L9baIywE7JE

accepted.name: Evgenii Shmoish
accepted.description: UX designer at day, developer at night

plugins.tagline: Apply spreadsheets to data grids in 3 easy steps. Supports component properties and text nodes.

Introduction

This plugin helps you batch replace local text styles in Figma with just a few clicks. It's ideal for managing multilingual design systems or switching between style versions efficiently.


Function Description

  1. Automatically loads all local text styles from the current file
  2. Provides dropdowns to select source and target styles
  3. Replaces text styles for selected text nodes in bulk
  4. Shows an empty state message if no local styles exist


How to Use

  1. Open the plugin to load local text styles automatically;
  2. Select the source and target styles from the dropdowns;
  3. Select the text nodes you want to modify;
  4. Click the â€œReplaceâ€ button to apply the change.


Notes

  1. Only local text styles are supported (no team styles);
  2. The plugin will show an empty state if no local styles exist;
  3. Make sure to select text layers before using the plugin.

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Batch replace local text styles with ease

  4. Click the â€œReplaceâ€ button to apply the change.


Notes

  1. Only local text styles are supported (no team styles);
  2. The plugin will show an empty state if no local styles exist;
  3. Make sure to select text layers before using the plugin.
